question:
What was the top-grade officers of the army called during the rule of the Vijayanagar kingdom?
1) Nayaks
2) Palaiyagars
3) Poligars
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: The important characteristics of the Vijayanagar administration was the Amara-Nayaka system. The top-grade officers of the army were known as Nayaks or Palaiyagars or Poligars. These officers were granted land in lieu of their services.
